titles.title: To provide for the development and dissemination of educational materials about responding to terrorist events involving a nuclear, biological, or chemical element, and to provide for an emergency medicine alert network.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 12/11/2001--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make a grant to or contract with nonprofit organizations for: (1) the development and dissemination of curriculum and materials for responding to a terrorist event involving a nuclear, biological, or chemical element, addressed to the informational, educational, and/or planning needs of health care professionals, the general public, and local governments and businesses; and (2) establish and maintain an emergency medicine alert network for use at the Federal and State levels for information sharing concerning a terrorist event and response methods.
